intro: Pentacalia psidiifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
